TriflicScript Web Interpreter Help

Overview

This is a web-based interpreter for TriflicScript. This page contains guidance on the use of said web interpreter; for information surrounding TriflicScript, please view the repository on GitHub.

Layout

The layout of the interpreter is kept relatively simple: STDIN is the Standard Input, where input to be interpreted is entered. After this is interpreted and executed by the TriflicScript runspace, any output will be directed into STDOUT. Below each input box are some additional settings, which will be covered below.

STDIN

  • Execute -- this will feed the content of STDIN into the TriflicScript runspace to be interpreted. This is keyboard-bound to Ctrl + Enter;
  • Upload File -- this will open a prompt to select a file, whose content will be read and interpeted;
  • Clear -- this will clear STDIN;
  • Time Execution -- if enabled, code parsing and execution will be timed. These statistics will be displayed in STDOUT below the expected output;
  • Last Command -- populated STDIN with the previously entered content in history. Bound to ArrowUp;
  • Next Command -- populated STDIN with the next entered content in history. Bound to ArrowDown;

STDOUT

  • Clear -- this will clear STDOUT;
  • Download -- this will download the current contents of STDOUT into a text file;

Restrictions

As this is a web-based interpreted, there are several restrictions places on the runspace. Most notable is the disability of accessing system information, restrictions to code importing via import(), etc...
